Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Make the ESLint ignore pattern more generic" (#8267) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`Unable to resolve dependencies` now shows full stack track in Error List & Output Window" (#10128) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Updating the same set of packages in PMUI, I see a difference in behavior in the output window. Did we intentionally append the stack trace to the output window?
/cc @srdjanjovcic & @erdembayar who I believe may have worked in this space.

### VS 16.7.5
> Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
> Error		Unable to resolve dependencies. 'Cucumber.Messages 13.1.0' is not compatible with 'SpecFlow 3.4.14 constraint: Cucumber.Messages (>= 6.0.1 && < 7.0.0)'.		
		
### VS 16.9.0 Preview 1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/96209978-eb991800-0f3e-11eb-8b33-2e2d466cf71d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/96210002-f81d7080-0f3e-11eb-8ef8-528a7387e52b.png)


> Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
> Error		StreamJsonRpc.RemoteInvocationException: Unable to resolve dependencies. 'Cucumber.Messages 13.1.0' is not compatible with 'SpecFlow 3.4.14 constraint: Cucumber.Messages (>= 6.0.1 && < 7.0.0)'. ---> System.InvalidOperationException: Unable to resolve dependencies. 'Cucumber.Messages 13.1.0' is not compatible with 'SpecFlow 3.4.14 constraint: Cucumber.Messages (>= 6.0.1 && < 7.0.0)'. ---> NuGet.Resolver.NuGetResolverConstraintException: Unable to resolve dependencies. 'Cucumber.Messages 13.1.0' is not compatible with 'SpecFlow 3.4.14 constraint: Cucumber.Messages (>= 6.0.1 && < 7.0.0)'.

>    --- End of inner exception stack trace ---

> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---

>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ValidateEnd(Task task)

>       at Microsoft.ServiceHub.Framework.ServiceJsonRpcDescriptor.LocalProxyGeneration.<ReturnedValueTaskOfTHelper>d__25`1.MoveNext()


## Repro Steps
1. Create an ASP.NET MVC Framework 4.7.2 app
1. Install SpecFlow (not latest version)
1. Clear NuGet Cache
1. Open PMUI Updates Tab
1. Select All packages
1. Select Update

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget restore packages.config won't end and blocks the Azure Pipeline for more than 1hr" (#10134) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

> I use Azure Pipelines Agent: windows-2019

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): `NuGet.exe` 

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): `5.7.0 x64 (https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v5.7.0/nuget.exe)`

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): `dotnet sdk 3.1.402`

VS version (if appropriate): `2019`

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): `Windows Server 2019 10.0.17763 Datacenter`

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: `Cannot tell because it's a random failure happened in many versions...`

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. `nuget restore ${{ parameters.testProjectDir }}/packages.config -OutputDirectory ${{ parameters.testProjectDir }}/../packages -Verbosity Detailed -NonInteractive`

2. Randomly stuck at nuget restore

## Other suggested things


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2201482/96207342-97715080-0f9d-11eb-8cd5-b7ecf369e9cf.png)


Because this is a random failure in Azure Pipeline Agent, so I cannot give a detailed repro steps.  
It happens randomly but very often, which is very annoying. We have to retry even more than 10 times to pass the CI.  
Please help us investigate the issue. We can follow your instructions to provide more logs. Thanks!

### Verbose Logs


Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "What's the Lifecycle Policy of NuGet Windows x86 Commandline?" (#7994) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: [Search product lifecyle](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/search?alpha=nuget) returns nothing about NuGet, nuget.org provides so many versions of CLI, and the recommended latest version is still v4.9.4 now, I'm wondering how are the versions supported? Is there any doc about this?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add Test Strategy section to our Spec template" (#10131) at NuGet/Home

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unexpected error occurs when trying to install a package having invalid client policies in PM UI " (#10034) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\30515.165
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5

## Installations
1. Install VS: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=4068483&view=ms.vss-build-web.run-extensions-tab
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Create a new test certificate` .\CreateTestCertificate.ps1 ‚ÄìAddAsTrustedRootAuthority.`
2. Sign a package: `NuGet.exe sign <PackageFilePath> -CertificatePath`.
3. Create a project, add required mode in NuGet.config file with no trusted signers:
  ```
<config>
     <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="require" />
  </config>
```
4. Reload the solution, update the package source to above package path, and install the package into a project in PM UI/CLI.

## Expected
Only error NU3034: signatureValidationMode is set to require, so packages are allowed only if signed by trusted signers; however, no trusted signers were specified occurred.

## Actual
Unexpected error occured below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/93317206-c4680180-f83f-11ea-9f18-14d1a32855ac.png)

## Error Message

Severity | Code | Description | Project | File | Line | Suppression State
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
Error | ¬† | StreamJsonRpc.RemoteInvocationException:   Package restore failed. Rolling back package changes for 'PC01'.¬†¬† at   Microsoft.ServiceHub.Framework.ServiceJsonRpcDescriptor.LocalProxyGeneration.<ReturnedValueTaskHelper>d__24.MoveNext()---   End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---¬†¬† at   System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task   task)¬†¬† at   System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task   task)¬†¬† at System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask.ThrowIfCompletedUnsuccessfully()¬†¬† at   NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.UIActionEngine.<>c__DisplayClass11_0.<<PerformActionImplAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext() | ¬† | ¬† | ¬† | ¬†
Error | ¬† | Package restore   failed. Rolling back package changes for 'PC01'. | ¬† | ¬† | ¬† | ¬†
Error | NU3034 | Package 'Package1   1.0.0' from source 'C:\Users\v-minlon\source\repos\Package1\Package1': This   package is signed but not by a trusted signer. | PC01 | C:\Users\v-minlon\source\repos\PC01\PC01\PC01.csproj | 1 | ¬†
Warning | NU3027 | Package 'Package1   1.0.0' from source 'C:\Users\v-minlon\source\repos\Package1\Package1': The   signature should be timestamped to enable long-term signature validity after   the certificate has expired. | PC01 | C:\Users\v-minlon\source\repos\PC01\PC01\PC01.csproj | 1 | ¬†

## Note
1. This issue repros in all the scenarios expected to have a error. 
2. It start to repro from Dev\5.8.0.6836.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Replace URL hyperlinks with HyperlinkButton controls" (#10130) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Throughout PMUI, we should be using the built-in [HyperlinkButton ](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.visualstudio.platformui.hyperlinkbutton?view=visualstudiosdk-2019) for any hyperlink which opens a URL.

Note: Any hyperlinks that don't actually open a URL should not be HyperlinkButtons. It's fine if they "look" like hyperlinks via a Style.

Example hyperlink to refactor:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Xamls/PackageMetadataControl.xaml#L267

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Push a package as unlisted" (#6891) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Scenario from .NET team:

Would like to push a number of packages unlisted and then list them all at the same time. How does one do that from CLI?

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Selecting "install with package manager" opens NuGet to wrong tab" (#10124) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1218224/selecting-install-with-package-manager-opens-nuget.html)._ --- When editing my .NET app if a Roslyn analyzer appears with a helpful suggestion that the code I am attempting to write is not possible because I am missing a package and gives me a helpful suggestion to "install with package manager" it then tries to open NuGet manager. This is where I hit a problem that I could reproduce easily. If the last time I used package manager I left my tab on for example "installed" it would be the tab that the analyzer would open and try to search for the missing package. This would show no results. But obviously it should have switched to "Browser" since the package was not in my solution. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 10/14/2020, 03:31 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### Feedback Bot on 10/14/2020, 01:04 PM:

Thanks for creating this issue! We figured it‚Äôs covering the same as another one we already have. Thus, we closed this one as a duplicate. We‚Äôve transferred all votes from this ticket to the other one. For more information, see also our issue reporting guidelines.

Happy coding!

#### kapenaga [MSFT] on 10/14/2020, 02:05 PM:

This issue is currently being investigated and could be because of another one we already have. Our team will get back to you if either more information is needed, a workaround is available, or the issue is resolved.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)
